byline.contributor: Charles Ornstein is a senior reporter for ProPublica, an independent, nonprofit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest. More on the issue of patient privacy.

abstract: Loopholes in the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act are allowing health providers to disclose potentially damaging information about patients as they pursue debts; problem is exemplified by actions of Short Hills Associates in Clinical Psychology, New Jersey group that has filed dozens of lawsuits against patients that disclosed diagnoses and treatments.
lead_paragraph: A federal patient privacy law has failed to prevent some health providers from making patient information available in suits for unpaid bills.
